references.paper_title: Finite and Infinite Games: A Vision of Life as Play and Possibility
references.reason: This book introduces the fundamental distinction between finite and infinite games, a core concept that underpins the philosophy and design of UNBOUNDED.  The authors' use of Carse's framework to classify games is central to their argument for the novelty of generative infinite games and provides a theoretical grounding for the entire paper.

references.paper_title: Language models are few-shot learners
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their capabilities. The authors' findings on few-shot learning are directly relevant to UNBOUNDED's use of a distilled LLM for generating game mechanics and narratives, demonstrating the potential of LLMs for real-time interactive game generation.

references.paper_title: Emerging properties in self-supervised vision transformers
references.reason: The techniques presented in this paper on self-supervised vision transformers (ViTs) are relevant to UNBOUNDED's visual generation component.  The authors’ work on improving the efficiency and effectiveness of vision transformers informs the design choices made in the regional IP-Adapter for efficient and consistent image generation.

references.paper_title: Dreamsim: Learning new dimensions of human visual similarity using synthetic data
references.reason: DreamSim's approach to learning visual similarity using synthetic data is directly relevant to the evaluation of UNBOUNDED's image generation capabilities.  The paper provides a valuable benchmark for assessing the quality and consistency of generated images, helping to establish the novelty and superiority of UNBOUNDED's image generation compared to prior methods.

references.paper_title: An image is worth one word: Personalizing text-to-image generation using textual inversion
references.reason: This paper explores personalization in text-to-image generation.  Its techniques for personalizing image generation using textual inversion are relevant to UNBOUNDED's character personalization features. The authors’ approach to personalizing the generation process improves the consistency of the character's appearance across different game states.

references.paper_title: Talecrafter: Interactive story visualization with multiple characters
references.reason: Talecrafter's focus on interactive story visualization with multiple characters provides insights for UNBOUNDED's narrative generation. The techniques used in Talecrafter to handle character interactions and generate coherent narratives in real-time are important for the development of UNBOUNDED's interactive storyline component.

references.paper_title: Lora: Low-rank adaptation of large language models
references.reason: The introduction of LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) is crucial to UNBOUNDED's approach to efficiently fine-tuning LLMs for interactive game generation.  Using LoRA, the authors adapt pre-trained language models with minimal computational overhead, achieving real-time interaction capabilities that are key to the gameplay experience.

references.paper_title: Dialoggen: Multi-modal interactive dialogue system for multi-turn text-to-image generation
references.reason: Dialoggen's focus on multi-modal interactive dialogue systems is directly relevant to UNBOUNDED’s interactive gameplay loop.  The methods used in Dialoggen for generating contextualized responses and maintaining consistent character behavior are important for creating an engaging and coherent interactive experience in UNBOUNDED.

references.paper_title: Multi-concept customization of text-to-image diffusion
references.reason: This work on multi-concept customization in text-to-image diffusion is highly relevant to UNBOUNDED's approach to maintaining visual consistency.  The techniques for customizing image generation based on multiple concepts (e.g., character and environment) are crucial for ensuring that the generated images are coherent and consistent with the game state and user inputs.

references.paper_title: Gligen: Open-set grounded text-to-image generation
references.reason: Gligen's approach to open-set grounded text-to-image generation addresses a key challenge in UNBOUNDED: generating diverse and consistent images across a wide range of environments and character actions.  The methods for handling open-set scenarios are important for ensuring that UNBOUNDED can generate varied and unexpected game events.

references.paper_title: Photomaker: Customizing realistic human photos via stacked id embedding
references.reason: Photomaker's approach to customizing human photos is directly relevant to UNBOUNDED's character personalization feature.  The methods for creating and modifying character appearances are crucial for providing users with the ability to create unique and customizable characters.

references.paper_title: Grounding dino: Marrying dino with grounded pre-training for open-set object detection
references.reason: Grounding-DINO is used in the evaluation of UNBOUNDED to assess the presence and visual quality of characters within the generated images.  This method helps ensure that the generated images accurately reflect the game state and that characters are consistently rendered across different environments.

references.paper_title: Latent consistency models: Synthesizing high-resolution images with few-step inference
references.reason: The introduction of Latent Consistency Models (LCMs) is fundamental to UNBOUNDED's ability to generate images in real time. LCMs enable fast image generation while maintaining high resolution, a critical component of the game's interactive gameplay.

references.paper_title: Sdxl: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: SDXL is the base diffusion model used for image generation in UNBOUNDED. This paper's advancements in high-resolution image synthesis are directly relevant to UNBOUNDED's capacity to generate high-quality and visually appealing images for the interactive game.

references.paper_title: Dreambooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: DreamBooth's approach to fine-tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation is crucial for UNBOUNDED's character personalization. DreamBooth enables users to create unique characters with consistent appearances across different game states, enhancing personalization and gameplay immersion.

references.paper_title: Reco: Retrieve and co-segment for zero-shot transfer
references.reason: Reco's approach to zero-shot transfer is relevant to UNBOUNDED's ability to generate diverse and consistent images across various environments.  The methods for adapting models to new situations without retraining are essential for creating an open-ended and unpredictable game experience.

references.paper_title: Gemma: Open models based on gemini research and technology
references.reason: Gemma is the base LLM used in UNBOUNDED. This paper's introduction of Gemma's architecture and capabilities is fundamental to understanding the LLM's capacity to generate game mechanics, narratives, and character interactions in real time.  The efficiency of Gemma enables real-time interaction in UNBOUNDED.

references.paper_title: Instantid: Zero-shot identity-preserving generation in seconds
references.reason: Instantid's focus on zero-shot identity-preserving generation is highly relevant to UNBOUNDED's goal of maintaining character consistency.  The methods for preserving character identity across multiple images are critical for creating a believable and immersive gaming experience.

references.paper_title: Ip-adapter: Text compatible image prompt adapter for text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: The IP-Adapter, although critiqued in the paper, serves as a starting point for the authors' development of a novel dynamic regional IP-Adapter. The analysis of the shortcomings of the original IP-Adapter highlights the motivation and contribution of the authors' improved version.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This work on adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models is highly relevant to UNBOUNDED's approach to controllable image generation. The methods for controlling image generation based on text prompts are crucial for ensuring that the generated images align with the game state and user inputs.
